marketNews.title: US Nonfarm Payrolls Exceed Expectations, Rupiah Pressured
marketNews.content:
The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) recorded a non-farm payroll (NFP) increase of 254,000 in September 2024, exceeding the 12-month average growth of 203,000. This result far surpassed the economists' expectation of 140,000 according to a Reuters survey and marked the strongest growth since March 2024. The September 2024 NFP increase was driven by the food-and-beverage services sector, health, government, social assistance, and construction.

The unemployment rate for September 2024 fell to 4.1%, lower than the Reuters survey and the August 2024 figure of 4.2%. In addition, the BLS revised July 2024 NFP upward to 144,000 (+61.8%) and August 2024 to 159,000 (+12%), both 72,000 higher than previously reported.

In response to the data release, market expectations for a Federal Reserve rate cut by year-end fell from 75 basis points (target range 4.0-4.25%) last week to 50 basis points (target range 4.25-4.5%) on Monday (7 Oct), according to the CME FedWatch Tool. The U.S. dollar index (DXY) rose 0.52% to 102.5 and the 10-year Treasury yield rose 20 basis points to 4.0%. U.S. equities reacted positively, with the S&P 500 closing up 0.9%, the Dow Jones up 0.76% and the Nasdaq up 1.22% on Friday (4 Oct) as hard-landing concerns eased.

Key Takeaway

For Indonesia, the development creates negative sentiment for the rupiah and government bonds. The rupiah weakened 1.26% to 15,680 per U.S. dollar on the day (7 Oct), while the 10-year government bond yield rose 8 basis points to 6.73%. The prospect of a smaller Fed rate-cut path could limit the space for Bank Indonesia to cut rates further. Bloomberg’s consensus on 7 Oct 2024 projects that BI will still cut rates by at least 25 basis points by year-end 2024 and at least two 25-basis-point cuts in 2025.

marketNews.title: Indonesia's Foreign Exchange Reserves Decline Slightly
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia disclosed that Indonesia’s foreign exchange reserves at the end of September 2024 stood at US$149.9 billion, slightly lower than the August 2024 level of US$150 billion. The decline in reserves was driven by foreign-government debt repayments. The reserve level at the end of September 2024 is equivalent to 6.6 months of import coverage or 6.4 months of import coverage plus foreign-government debt payments.

marketNews.title: National Youth Entrepreneurs Association Proposes National Investment Fund
marketNews.content: The head of the National Youth Entrepreneurs Association (Repnas), Anggawira, said that the proposal to create a National Investment Fund (DIN) has entered the discussion of the Prabowo-Griban team. He explained that the DIN would manage state investments for strategic projects and would resemble Saudi Arabia’s Public Investment Fund (PIF) or Singapore’s Temasek.

marketNews.title: OJK Urges Caution on BNPL to Youth Over-Indebtedness
marketNews.content: The Chief Executive of the Financial Services Business Conduct, Education and Consumer Protection Agency of OJK, Friderica Widyasari Dewi, said that banks and financing companies should be more cautious in offering Buy-Now-Pay-Later (BNPL) products to young people. She warned that over-indebtedness among the youth is a global concern.

marketNews.title: Gaikindo May Revise 2024 New-Car Sales Target
marketNews.content: The chairman of the Indonesian Automotive Industry Association (Gaikindo), Jongkie Sugiarto, said the association may revise its 2024 new-car sales target of 1.1 million units. He noted that consumer purchasing power has fallen significantly, directly slowing vehicle purchases. He added that there has been a slight increase in the second half of the year, but the figure remains insignificant.

marketNews.title: RIGS Acquires Tug Boat and Plans Charter Service Expansion
marketNews.content: Rig Tenders Indonesia (RIGS), through its subsidiary PT Batuah Abadi Lines, procured assets worth IDR 10 billion in the form of the tug boat PEC 2416 purchased from PT Dok Pendingin. In a separate disclosure, RIGS plans to add a ship-charter and tonnage-per-distance service, with pricing based on daily time-charter or tonnage-kilometre calculations. The plan will be discussed at the RUPST scheduled for 13 November 2024.

marketNews.title: Vietnam Q3 2024 GDP Grows 7.4% YoY, Highest in Two Years
marketNews.content: Vietnam recorded a 7.4% year-on-year GDP growth in Q3 2024 (versus 6.93% YoY in Q2 2024 and 7.09% YoY in Q3 2023), the strongest in two years. The result far exceeded the Bloomberg consensus of 6.1% YoY, even though Vietnam’s manufacturing sector contracted in September 2024 due to Typhoon Yagi. Exports in Q3 2024 rose 15.8% YoY, driving the growth.

tickerNews.title: TOBA Announces $145 Million Divestment and $31 Million Share Buyback
tickerNews.content: $TOBA: TBS Energi Utama announced a divestment of two coal-fired power plant (PLTU) units. The transaction is split into (i) the sale of all shares and the transfer of all receivables held by the company in PT Gorontalo Listrik Perdana and (ii) the sale of all shares held by its subsidiary PT Toba Bara Energi in PT Minahasa Cahaya Lestari. The total transaction value is US$144.8 million (≈ IDR 2.2 trillion), with PT Kalibiru Sulawesi Abadi as the buyer. In addition, TOBA announced a buyback of 816 million shares, representing 10% of the issued and paid-up capital. The buyback allocation totals US$30.8 million (≈ IDR 474.5 billion). Both actions will be submitted for approval at the extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on 14 November 2024.

tickerNews.title: FILM Plans Private Placement to Fund Net Visi Media Acquisition
tickerNews.content: $FILM: MD Entertainment plans a private placement of up to 951,121,700 new shares, equal to 10% of the issued and paid-up capital, at an execution price of IDR 3,891 per share, potentially raising about IDR 3.7 trillion. Approximately IDR 1.65 trillion of the proceeds will be used to acquire Net Visi Media ($NETV). The remaining funds will support FILM’s group business development and potential expansion. The company will seek shareholder approval at the extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on 8 October 2024.

tickerNews.title: PTRO Major Shareholder Caraka Reksa Optima Sells 20 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $PTRO: One of Petrosea’s majority shareholders, PT Caraka Reksa Optima, sold 20 million PTRO shares. The transaction, recorded in KSEI data on 30 September 2024, did not disclose a transaction value. After the sale, Caraka Reksa Optima’s ownership in PTRO fell from 36.15% to 34.17%.

tickerNews.title: LABA Signs Battery Supply Deal with ECGO, Targets 31,000 Units by Year-End
tickerNews.content: $LABA: Green Power Group’s President Director William Ong said the company has signed a cooperation agreement with PT Green City Traffic (ECGO) to supply electric-motor batteries. To date, LABA has sold 9,000 units to ECGO and targets 31,000 units by year-end, before rising to 600,000 units in the following year.

tickerNews.title: BJTM Plans Acquisition of 476 Million BEKS Shares
tickerNews.content: $BJTM: Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Timur announced a plan to acquire 476 million shares, becoming the new controlling shareholder of Bank Pembangunan Daerah Banten (BEKS). The transaction value and closing timeline were not disclosed. After becoming the controlling shareholder of BEKS, BJTM will conduct a mandatory tender offer at a price equal to the highest daily trading price on the IDX during the 90-day period from 6 July 2024 to 3 October 2024. The aim is to form a Banking Business Group (KUB) to strengthen structure, resilience and competitiveness of the national banking sector.

tickerNews.title: TAMU Sells Accommodation Work Barge to Pertamina, Restructures Credit with BMRI
tickerNews.content: $TAMU: Pelayaran Tamarin Samudra sold one Accommodation Work Barge (AWB) named Petroleum Superior to PT Pertamina Trans Kontinental for an estimated US$13.8 million (≈ IDR 214 billion) to settle part of the company’s liabilities. In a separate transaction, TAMU signed a credit restructuring with Bank Mandiri (BMRI) that will remain in effect until December 2026, modifying the principal and interest payment schedule each month.

tickerNews.title: ADES Shares Sold by Water Partners Bottling SA
tickerNews.content: $ADES: The controlling shareholder Water Partners Bottling SA sold 1,000,000 ADES shares at an average price of IDR 9,000 per share on 3 October 2024. The transaction value totals IDR 9 billion. After the transaction, Water Partners Bottling SA’s ownership in ADES fell from 91.52% to 91.35%.
